CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Fan Engagement stage positioned above or below the Post-Event Feedback stage?
SRP.A: The Fan Engagement stage is positioned {above} the Post-Event Feedback stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {linear} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Post-Event Feedback?
VE.A: The value of stage Post-Event Feedback is {548}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Event Attendance?
VE.A: The value of stage Event Attendance is {1199}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Merchandise Purchase?
VE.A: The value of stage Merchandise Purchase is {287}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Event Announcement, with a value of {1842}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Merchandise Purchase, with a value of {287}.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Post-Event Feedback to stage Merchandise Purchase?
SC.A: Decreased by {261} Participants from stage Post-Event Feedback to stage Merchandise Purchase.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Ticket Purchase to stage Event Attendance?
SC.A: Decreased by {335} Participants from stage Ticket Purchase to stage Event Attendance.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 1038? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Event Announcement} stage has {1842}, the {Ticket Purchase} stage has {1534}, the {Event Attendance} stage has {1199}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 417? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 713 and 1366? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Event Attendance} stage has {1199}, the {Fan Engagement} stage has {878}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Event Announcement to Ticket Purchase, or from stage Post-Event Feedback to Merchandise Purchase?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Event Announcement} to {Ticket Purchase} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Event Attendance to Fan Engagement, or from stage Post-Event Feedback to Merchandise Purchase?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Event Attendance} to {Fan Engagement} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Event Attendance to Fan Engagement, from stage Fan Engagement to Post-Event Feedback, or from stage Ticket Purchase to Event Attendance?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Ticket Purchase} to stage {Event Attendance} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Ticket Purchase} and {Event Attendance} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Post-Event Feedback} and {Merchandise Purchase} stages.
